description.narrative: The G20 has established infrastructure development as a key pillar of its future work program. It has established a High Level Panel on Infrastructure which with the Multilateral Development Bank (MDB) Working Group is developing a program to accelerate investment in infrastructure to meet the significant funding shortfall in low and middle income countries. The focus of the proposed actions of the G20 is promoting public private partnerships (PPPs), strengthening the enabling environment, and other measures to leverage more private sector investment. The range of measures put forward by the G20 and MDBs are complex and have had varying degrees of success in the past. Analysis is to be undertaken of the approach and measures that are being proposed by the G20, including determining what has and has not worked in the past, and why some countries and sectors have been more successful than others in attracting private investment. Key issues would be identifying the key impediments to
